Tasks.Task Description: Gather detailed requirements for the containerized applications, including scalability, availability, and security needs. Identify the workloads and services to be deployed on Azure Red Hat OpenShift.
Design the architecture for the OpenShift cluster, including node sizing, network configuration, and integration with existing Azure resources.
Secure approvals and authorizations for the project, including budget allocation and compliance checks.

Tasks.Task: Provision Azure Red Hat OpenShift Cluster
Tasks.Task Description: Deploy the Azure Red Hat OpenShift cluster using the Azure portal, CLI, or ARM templates. Ensure proper configuration of the cluster during provisioning.
Set up networking for the OpenShift cluster, including virtual networks, subnets, and firewall rules. Ensure secure connectivity between the cluster and other Azure resources.
Apply security best practices, such as role-based access control (RBAC), encryption, and integration with Azure Active Directory for authentication.
Deploy the containerized applications to the OpenShift cluster. Configure application scaling, health checks, and resource limits.
Configure monitoring and alerting for the OpenShift cluster using Azure Monitor and OpenShift tools. Set up alerts for resource usage, application performance, and cluster health.
Perform testing of the OpenShift cluster and deployed applications, including failover scenarios, performance benchmarks, and security validation.
Create detailed documentation for the cluster setup, application deployment, and operational procedures. Share documentation with the operations team.
Provide training sessions for the operations team on managing and troubleshooting the OpenShift cluster and containerized applications.
Ensure the OpenShift cluster and applications meet regulatory compliance requirements. Set up regular auditing procedures to verify compliance and security postures.
